bill_title: revise the causes for which a teacher's certificate may be revoked or suspended and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the causes for which a teacher's certificate may be revoked or suspended. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-42-9 be amended to read as follows: 13-42-9. The secretary of the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs may revoke or suspend any certificate for any cause which would have prevented its issue, or after dismissal for plain violation of contract, gross immorality, incompetency, violation of the code of ethics of the Professional Teachers Practices and Standards Commission or the Professional Administrators Practices and Standards Commission in effect on January 1, 1999, or flagrant neglect of duty, and may suspend any certificate for a period not to exceed one year for breaking or jumping a contract, if such suspension is requested by the school board. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the causes for which a teacher's certificate may be revoked or suspended. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-42-9 be amended to read as follows: 13-42-9. The secretary of the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs may revoke or suspend any certificate for any cause which would have prevented its issue, or after dismissal for plain violation of contract, gross immorality, incompetency, violation of the code of ethics in effect on January 1, 1999, as determined by the Professional Teachers Practices and Standards Commission or the Professional Administrators Practices and Standards Commission, or flagrant neglect of duty, and may suspend any certificate for a period not to exceed one year for breaking or jumping a contract, if such suspension is requested by the school board. Section 2. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health, or safety, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval. BILL HISTORY 1/12/99 First read in House and referred to Education. H.J. 37 1/14/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/19/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/19/99 Education Deferred to another day. 1/21/99 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/21/99 Education Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 12, NAYS 0. H.J. 106

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the causes for which a teacher's certificate may be revoked or suspended and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-42-9 be amended to read as follows: 13-42-9. The secretary of the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs may revoke or suspend any certificate for any cause which would have prevented its issue, or after dismissal for plain violation of contract, gross immorality, incompetency, violation of the code of ethics in effect on January 1, 1999, as determined by the Professional Teachers Practices and Standards Commission or the Professional Administrators Practices and Standards Commission, or flagrant neglect of duty, and may suspend any certificate for a period not to exceed one year for breaking or jumping a contract, if such suspension is requested by the school board. Section 2. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the immediate preservation of the public peace, health, or safety, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval. BILL HISTORY 1/12/99 First read in House and referred to Education.
